intro: Jasione perennis proles tajae, commonly known as the Tajan's everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
